name: hc_arctic_condensation
query: Rooftop installation in Northern Norway. Outdoor temperature: -40¬∞C. Exhaust air: 20¬∞C / 50% RH. We want GDB-FZ.

turns.content: Rooftop installation in Northern Norway. Outdoor temperature: -40¬∞C. Exhaust air: 20¬∞C / 50% RH. We want GDB-FZ.

The GDB family is not suitable for your rooftop installation in Northern Norway due to the risk of Outdoor Condensation. Outdoor installations require thermally insulated housings to prevent condensation on the metal surfaces.Additionally, the high humidity environment can reduce the carbon adsorption efficiency and accelerate corrosion. The housing corrosion class is C2.Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. The GDB family uses BOLTED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for outdoor environments. A solution would need to be rated for outdoor installation and use a construction type that meets the necessary leakage and hygiene standards.I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified that the requested GDB housing is unsuitable for the specified application. It accurately cited the catalog's limitation that GDB is for indoor use only and uninsulated, applying sound engineering logic regarding condensation risks in -40¬∞C conditions and corrosion issues in coastal environments.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as uninsulated and for indoor use only (PDF p.8: 'F√∂r inomhusbruk', 'oisolerat enkelv√§ggsutf√∂rande').
dimension_explanations.completeness: Fully addresses the environmental constraints, material limitations, and provides a clear recommendation to seek custom engineering.
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent risk identification; installing an uninsulated housing in -40¬∞C would lead to severe condensation and freezing, which the system blocked.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Strong physics-based reasoning connecting the temperature differential (-40¬∞C vs 20¬∞C) to condensation risks on uninsulated metal.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adhered to the 'Indoor use' constraint explicitly stated in the PDF.

strengths: Accurate identification of 'Indoor use only' limitation
Sound engineering logic regarding condensation and thermal bridges
Correct corrosion class identification (C2) for GDB

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that GDB is an indoor, uninsulated/single-wall housing and is a poor fit for rooftop subarctic conditions with high condensation/icing risk, but it introduces unsupported claims (carbon efficiency, hygiene/leakage class) and incorrectly asserts a hard product-rule block without checking catalog-available material/alternatives. It also fails to move the dialog forward with targeted clarifying questions (size/flow, duct connection, required insulation strategy) and gives an over-broad ‚Äúno standard product‚Äù conclusion.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF confirms GDB is ‚ÄúF√∂r inomhusbruk‚Äù and typically FZ C2 (e.g., GDB-600x600 has Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h and exists in lengths 550/600 or 750/800), but the assistant‚Äôs claims about carbon adsorption loss from humidity and specific ‚Äúbolted construction not meeting leakage/hygiene requirements‚Äù are not supported by the provided catalog excerpt.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It does not request key missing inputs (airflow, required W√óH, allowable length, connection type PG/flange, expected water management) and does not propose the closest catalog alternatives (e.g., insulated GDMI variants or corrosion-upgrade options).
dimension_explanations.safety: Appropriately highlights outdoor condensation/icing risk for a non-insulated indoor housing in -40¬∞C ambient and avoids recommending an unsafe rooftop configuration.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, with a clear warning and escalation path to engineering support.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The condensation risk logic is plausible, but it mixes in unsupported statements (carbon performance, hygiene/leakage class, bolted construction) and makes a definitive ‚Äòno standard product‚Äô leap without structured elimination against catalog options.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It enforces constraints too aggressively and partly incorrectly: the PDF does not state GDB is disqualified due to leakage/hygiene class or ‚Äòbolted‚Äô construction, and it ignores that the catalog notes multiple material options in general (FZ/ZM/RF) while GDB page states typical FZ‚Äîso a hard block is not justified from the PDF alone.

strengths: Correctly identifies outdoor condensation/thermal-bridging risk for an uninsulated indoor housing at -40¬∞C ambient.
Maintains a technical-sales appropriate tone and refrains from issuing a risky product card.
weaknesses: Introduces non-catalog claims (carbon adsorption degradation due to humidity, hygiene/leakage class and construction-type prohibitions) without evidence in the PDF.
Fails to ask essential sizing/selection questions and does not propose nearest standard catalog alternatives (e.g., insulated GDMI/GDMI FLEX where applicable).
pdf_citations: GDB: stated as ‚ÄúF√∂r inomhusbruk‚Äù and typically manufactured in galvanized/FZ with corrosion class C2; standard lengths 550 mm (short bag filters) and 750 mm (long bag/compact) (GDB section in provided PDF images).
GDB 600x600: Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h; available lengths 550/600 and 750/800; weights 27 kg (550/600) and 34 kg (750/800) (GDB dimension table in provided PDF images).

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies real risks (condensation, corrosion) for a rooftop installation in extreme arctic conditions, but overstates the blocking rationale with some inaccurate claims. GDB is described as 'for indoor use' (PDF p.8) and is single-wall uninsulated, so blocking outdoor rooftop use has engineering merit. However, the system fabricates claims about 'hygiene requirements for outdoor environments' and 'leakage class' issues that are not relevant to this scenario, and incorrectly states GDB corrosion class as C2 when the PDF says C2 for standard FZ material ‚Äî which is actually correct but the reasoning around it is muddled.

dimension_explanations.correctness: GDB is indeed described as 'F√∂r inomhusbruk' (indoor use, PDF p.8) with standard FZ at corrosion class C2, making the outdoor block directionally correct. However, the system incorrectly introduces 'hygiene requirements for outdoor environments' and 'leakage class' concerns that are not standard considerations for outdoor rooftop carbon filter installations ‚Äî these are fabricated constraints.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system blocks the configuration and recommends contacting custom engineering, but fails to suggest viable alternatives such as GDMI (insulated, C4-rated) with ZM material, or upgrading to RF/SF material for better corrosion resistance, which would have been helpful.
dimension_explanations.safety: The core safety concerns ‚Äî condensation risk at -40¬∞C on uninsulated single-wall housing, and inadequate corrosion protection (C2 FZ in a harsh coastal/arctic environment) ‚Äî are valid and important warnings for this extreme application.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, appropriately directing the user to custom engineering support for a challenging application.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The condensation and corrosion reasoning is sound, but the mention of 'hygiene requirements' and 'leakage class' for outdoor environments is a logical non-sequitur that undermines the otherwise valid engineering argument.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly blocks GDB-FZ for outdoor rooftop use based on its indoor-only rating, but the stated reasons mix valid constraints (single-wall, C2 corrosion) with fabricated ones (hygiene, leakage class for outdoor), making the constraint reasoning partially incorrect.

strengths: Correctly identifies that GDB is rated for indoor use only and blocks the outdoor rooftop configuration
Appropriately flags condensation risk when mixing -40¬∞C outdoor air with 20¬∞C/50% RH exhaust through an uninsulated housing
weaknesses: Fabricates 'hygiene requirements for outdoor environments' and 'leakage class' concerns that are not relevant to this rooftop exhaust scenario
Fails to suggest viable alternatives such as GDMI with ZM material (insulated, C4) or stainless steel options that could address the arctic rooftop requirements
pdf_citations: GDB is described as 'F√∂r inomhusbruk' (for indoor use) on PDF p.8
GDB standard material is FZ (galvanized) at corrosion class C2 (PDF p.8), while ZM is C5 and RF is C5 (PDF p.4)
GDMI is insulated ('v√§rme- och kondensisolerat') and available in ZM (C4) ‚Äî a potential alternative not mentioned (PDF p.11)

content_segments.text: The GDB family is not suitable for your rooftop installation in Northern Norway due to the risk of Outdoor Condensation. Outdoor installations require thermally insulated housings to prevent condensation on the metal surfaces.
content_segments.inference_logic: Outdoor installation causes condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces. Double-wall insulated housing required to maintain surface above dew point. Stressor: Outdoor Condensation | Required trait: Thermal Insulation

content_segments.text: Additionally, the high humidity environment can reduce the carbon adsorption efficiency and accelerate corrosion. The housing corrosion class is C2.
content_segments.inference_logic: High humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. Keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance. Stressor: High Humidity | Relevant trait: Porous Adsorption. Persistent humidity accelerates zinc corrosion, reducing service life. Consider C4 or C5 materials. Stressor: High Humidity | Relevant trait: Corrosion Resistance C3

content_segments.text: Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. The GDB family uses BOLTED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for outdoor environments. A solution would need to be rated for outdoor installation and use a construction type that meets the necessary leakage and hygiene standards.
content_segments.inference_logic: Product not rated for ENV_OUTDOOR installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses BOLTED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

content_segments.text: I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.
